data.title: PURPOSE
questions: In this phase, set clear expectations and intention for this conversation.
Announce the topic/purpose of the conversation/meeting…
(example) “I’d like to discuss your presentation this morning…”
Give them a choice, an ‘out’, or as much autonomy as possible.
(example) “Is now a good time, or would you prefer later today?”
State why it’s important, and your intent to help them.

data.title: VALUE
questions: In this phase, assure the person of their value.
(If the person is typically sensitive to critique/redirecting feedback…)
Reiterate the person's value to the team, organization, etc.

data.title: SITUATION
questions: In this phase, get agreement on their situation/context.
State: “Your task/challenge/goal was to...”
Confirm shared understanding with employee.
Ask “What else would you add about the situation?”
Ensure your expectations were clearly understood.

data.title: BEHAVIOR
questions: In this phase, make explicit the behavior which needs to change.
State: “Here's what I saw/heard…” OR “I noticed/observed…” OR
“Here are the facts... (no interpretations, perceptions or judgments).
Ask: “What data am I missing?” Insist on data, evidence or examples.
Confirm shared understanding of what was said and done.
If they dismiss it, reiterate your expectations and the facts.
If they deny or disagree with the facts (rare), own your perceptions.
If they defend themselves, point out their accountability.

data.title: RESULTS
questions: In this phase, make clear the consequences/impacts of their behavior.
State: “As a result…” OR “It resulted in…” OR “The consequence was…” OR
State: “Here's how it impacted the team, the customer, me…”
Ask: “What could you have done to change the outcome?” OR
“What would have changed that result?” OR “What could you do?” OR
“What will you do differently next time?”
Say: “And what do you think would be the result?”
Once the person has committed to the new behavior, proceed.

data.title: COMMITMENT
questions: In this phase, get them to state their commitment to change, and reiterate your expectation.
“I have a better understanding of your situation, and…”
“I hope you understand the behavior/performance expected.”
“I appreciate your commitment to follow-through on this.”
“Let me know if you need coaching to help you improve.”
“I look forward to seeing you turn this around.”
“Let me know when you make it happen.”
“Let’s check your progress on (date).”
